intro: Monopsis scabra var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth monopsis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. This variant is distinguished by its reduced pubescence compared to the typical variety of Monopsis scabra.
